title: This '80s make-up staple has had a high-tech revamp
text:
Make-up artists wouldn’t dream of turning up on set without one, sales have risen steadily over the last few years, and the newest formulations do so much more than keeping shine at bay. It’s official, face powder is back.

Reaching its peak in the 80s, setting powder was used for centuries by some of the world’s most iconic women. From Cleopatra and Queen Elizabeth I to Madonna and Jerry Hall, these ladies were rarely seen without a heavy layer of the stuff.

However, as the 90s rolled around this cakey make-up staple fell out of favour as a decidedly more natural look gained traction. Then the likes of Giselle, Karlie Kloss, and Daria Werbowy hit the scene with their glowing, dewy complexions...
description: Make-up artists wouldn’t dream of turning up on set without one, sales have risen steadily over the last few years, and the newest formulations do so much more than keeping shine at bay.
